title.narrative: PROMOAIR - Ilmanlaadun seurannan ja hallintojarjestelmien modernisaation edistaminen Vietnamin kaupunkialueilla
PROMOAIR - Promoting Modernisation of Air Quality Observation and Management Systems in Urban Areas of Vi?t Nam -

description.narrative: The goal of the ICI project Promoair is to improve the availability of air quality information of good quality to the Vietnamese authorities and citizens. Air pollution is a significant and worsening problem in Viet Nam. Air quality monitoring and other da ta and forecasts of qood quality are a prerequisite for effective well targeted and justified decisions to improve air quality and the adverse health effects of bad air quality. Up-to-date and quality air quality information also help citizens to better pr otect themselves from air pollution.The implementing partners of the project are the Finnish Meteorological Institute FMI the Vietnam Environment Agency VEA and under VEA the Northern Centre for Environmental Monitoring (NCEM) that is responsible for air q uality monitoring on the ground. The project supports to build their capacity in monitoring air quality comprehensively and with good quality as well as to produce air quality forecasts based on the monitoring data. The pilot city in the project is Hanoi. The project is based on the cooperation between the project partners FMI VEA NCEM and the Hanoi EPA (Environment Protection Agency) in a project funded by the World Bank as well on the long-standing cooperation of FMI in Vietnam in the field of meteorology . The projects supports the achievement of the SUstainable Development Goals 3 and 11 by supporting Viet Nam to prevent deaths and illnesses from air pollution and to monitor the level of fine particulate matter. Better air quality information also support s the adoption of renewable and clean energy sources and targeting of policies thus supporting the fourth development priority of the Finnish development policy; sustainable use of natural resources. The project also supports the creation of commercial par tnerships between Finland and Viet Nam.The project is implemented in 2020-2022 and its overall budget is 600 000 euros. The project modality is the institutional cooperation instrument (ICI). The project adheres to the Norm and Manual guiding the implement ation of ICI projects.
